What does "BNN" stand for?: What is a core principle of BNNs?
Bayesian Neural Network: To represent a distribution over functions instead of a single function.

What does "BNN" stand for?: Why are Bayesian methods sometimes preferred in deep learning?
Bayesian Neural Network: They are principled, generally interpretable, and may improve generalization.

What does "BNN" stand for?: Why can Bayesian methods be less used sometimes?
What are the two main kinds of generalisation for BNNs?
What is the main difference between in- and out-of-distribution generalisation?
Bayesian Neural Network: The future data is drawn from the training/testing distribution (in) or from another (out)
